title: Using BioShiftR
text: BioShiftR helper package facilitate easy use manipulation BioShifts database, includes 31,000 species’ range shift documentations published scientific literature, well methodological, taxonomic, climate variables within study regions , available, within study regions clipped species’ ranges. Use package’s helper functions easily merge, subset, manipulate dataset data organization hypothesis testing. vignette covers workflow censusing shifts adding relevant parameters.

title: Using BioShiftR
text: BioShiftR workflows begin get_shifts() function, uploads , subset , 31,759 range shift observations within BioShifts database. function returns minimal dataset showing range shift rates across latitude elevation (calc_rate), calculated BioShifts either m/year elevational shifts, km/year latitudinal shifts (calc_unit), necessary identifiers connect datasets. get_shifts() built-defaults subset shifts type, broad taxonomic groups, continents. See function help page options. example, select latitudinal range shifts birds North America, use following arguments.
code: get_shifts() %>% glimpse() #> Rows: 31,759 #> Columns: 13 #> $ id                  <chr> "A001_P1_ELE_O_M1", "A001_P1_ELE_O_M1", "A001_P1_E… #> $ article_id          <chr> "A001", "A001", "A001", "A001", "A001", "A001", "A… #> $ poly_id             <chr> "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P… #> $ method_id           <chr> "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "… #> $ eco                 <chr> "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "… #> $ type                <chr> "ELE", "ELE", "ELE", "ELE", "ELE", "ELE", "ELE", "… #> $ param               <chr> "O", "O", "O", "O", "O", "O", "O", "O", "O", "O", … #> $ sp_name_publication <chr> "Aegithalos_caudatus", "Certhia_familiaris", "Dend… #> $ sp_name_checked     <chr> "Aegithalos_caudatus", "Certhia_familiaris", "Dend… #> $ subsp_or_pop        <chr> "Giffre Valley", "Giffre Valley", "Giffre Valley",… #> $ calc_rate           <dbl> -2.2128, -0.5106, -7.8723, -3.2340, 4.8511, -1.319… #> $ calc_unit           <chr> "m/year", "m/year", "m/year", "m/year", "m/year", … #> $ direction           <chr> "Lower Elevation", "Lower Elevation", "Lower Eleva… # return all latitudinal range shifts for Birds in North America get_shifts(group = "Birds", type = "LAT", continent = "North America") %>% glimpse() #> Rows: 2,382 #> Columns: 13 #> $ id                  <chr> "A009_P1_LAT_LE_M1", "A009_P1_LAT_LE_M1", "A009_P1… #> $ article_id          <chr> "A009", "A009", "A009", "A009", "A009", "A009", "A… #> $ poly_id             <chr> "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P… #> $ method_id           <chr> "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "… #> $ eco                 <chr> "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "… #> $ type                <chr> "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "… #> $ param               <chr> "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "L… #> $ sp_name_publication <chr> "Accipiter_cooperii", "Accipiter_striatus", "Actit… #> $ sp_name_checked     <chr> "Accipiter_cooperii", "Accipiter_striatus", "Actit… #> $ subsp_or_pop        <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA… #> $ calc_rate           <dbl> 13.78, 0.18, 1.92, 0.51, 0.35, 6.48, 14.71, 0.61, … #> $ calc_unit           <chr> "km/year", "km/year", "km/year", "km/year", "km/ye… #> $ direction           <chr> "Expansion", "Expansion", "Expansion", "Expansion"…  # count how many have positive rates (moving towards the poles) get_shifts(group = "Birds", type = "LAT", continent = "North America") %>% count(calc_rate > 0) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   `calc_rate > 0`     n #>   <lgl>           <int> #> 1 FALSE             948 #> 2 TRUE             1434

title: Using BioShiftR
text: BioShiftR includes various helper functions – used individually together – supplement dataset get_shifts() function data values. View table see funcitons respective information add shifts dataframe.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jake Lawlor. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lawlor J (2025). BioShiftR: Access manipulate data species' range shifts BioShifts database. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {BioShiftR: Access and manipulate data on species' range shifts from the BioShifts database},   author = {Jake Lawlor},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/}, }

code: get_shifts(group = "Birds", continent = "Africa") |> add_articles() |> dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 2 #> Columns: 17 #> $ id                  <chr> "A175_P1_LAT_O_M1", "A175_P2_LAT_O_M1" #> $ article_id          <chr> "A175", "A175" #> $ poly_id             <chr> "P1", "P2" #> $ method_id           <chr> "M01", "M01" #> $ eco                 <chr> "Ter", "Ter" #> $ type                <chr> "LAT", "LAT" #> $ param               <chr> "O", "O" #> $ sp_name_publication <chr> "Hirundo_rustica", "Hirundo_rustica" #> $ sp_name_checked     <chr> "Hirundo_rustica", "Hirundo_rustica" #> $ subsp_or_pop        <chr> "Cluster North", "Cluster South" #> $ calc_rate           <dbl> 3.45, -8.89 #> $ calc_unit           <chr> "km/year", "km/year" #> $ direction           <chr> "Towards Poles", "Towards Equator" #> $ article             <chr> "Ambrosini_al_2011_CR", "Ambrosini_al_2011_CR" #> $ doi                 <chr> "10.3354/cr01025", "10.3354/cr01025" #> $ id_bioshifts_v1     <dbl> 209, 209 #> $ id_core             <dbl> 424, 424

what: Add baseline temperatures of species- or study-area polygons for each range shift — add_baselines
title: Add baseline temperatures of species- or study-area polygons for each range shift — add_baselines
text: Add baseline temperatures species- study-area polygons range shift

title: Add baseline temperatures of species- or study-area polygons for each range shift — add_baselines
code: add_baselines(   data,   type = "SA",   stat = c("mean"),   exp = c("temp"),   res = c(LAT = "25km", ELE = "1km") )

title: Add baseline temperatures of species- or study-area polygons for each range shift — add_baselines
text: data input data get_shifts() type Choice baseline temperatures study area (SA) species area (SP) polygons. stat Statistic given variable. Choices min, 1Q, median, mean, 3Q, max. exp Exposure variable; Choices "temp" (temperature") "precip" (precipitation), . res Calculation resolution. Baseline temperatures species/study area calculated environmental raster layers four resolutions: 1km, 25km, 50km, 110km, resulting slightly different values. Choose specific res ("1km","25km","50km","110km"), use "best" ensure shift matching temperature (see vignette)

title: Add baseline temperatures of species- or study-area polygons for each range shift — add_baselines
text: Shifts database supplemented selected temperature /precipitation baseline values within study area species-specific study area.

title: Add baseline temperatures of species- or study-area polygons for each range shift — add_baselines
code: get_shifts() |> add_baselines() #> # A tibble: 31,759 × 15 #>    id         article_id poly_id method_id eco   type  param sp_name_publication #>    <chr>      <chr>      <chr>   <chr>     <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>               #>  1 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Ambloplites_rupest… #>  2 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Ameiurus_nebulosus  #>  3 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Chrosomus_eos       #>  4 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Lepomis_gibbosus    #>  5 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Lepomis_macrochirus #>  6 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Luxilus_cornutus    #>  7 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Micropterus_dolomi… #>  8 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Micropterus_salmoi… #>  9 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Notemigonus_crysol… #> 10 A002_P1_L… A002       P1      M01       Ter   LAT   LE    Notropis_atherinoi… #> # ℹ 31,749 more rows #> # ℹ 7 more variables: sp_name_checked <chr>, subsp_or_pop <chr>, #> #   calc_rate <dbl>, calc_unit <chr>, direction <chr>, #> #   baseline_mean_temp <dbl>, baseline_res <chr> get_shifts(eco = "Mar") |> add_baselines(res = "25km") #> Error in get_shifts(eco = "Mar"): unused argument (eco = "Mar")

what: Add Climate Velocity to shifts dataframe — add_cv
title: Add Climate Velocity to shifts dataframe — add_cv
text: Add Climate Velocity shifts dataframe

title: Add Climate Velocity to shifts dataframe — add_cv
code: add_cv(   data,   type = "SA",   stat = c("mean"),   exp = c("temp"),   res = c(LAT = "25km", ELE = "1km") )

title: Add Climate Velocity to shifts dataframe — add_cv
text: data Shifts dataframe get_shifts() function type Choice climate velocity values study area (SA) species-speficic study area (SP) polygons stat Statistic climate velocity add. c("min", "1Q", "median", "mean", "3Q", "max") exp Exposure variable. c("temp","precip") res Spatial resolution climate velocities calculated c("1km","25km","50km","110km"). Note higher resolutions generally higher velocities, since climate velocity calculated climate trend / spatial gradient.

title: Add Climate Velocity to shifts dataframe — add_cv
text: dataframe range shifts supplemented selected columns climate velocity.

title: Add Climate Velocity to shifts dataframe — add_cv
code: get_shifts() |> add_cv(stat = c("mean"), exp = c("temp"),res = c("LAT" = "25km", "ELE" = "1km")) |> dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 31,759 #> Columns: 17 #> $ id                  <chr> "A002_P1_LAT_LE_M1", "A002_P1_LAT_LE_M1", "A002_P1… #> $ article_id          <chr> "A002", "A002", "A002", "A002", "A002", "A002", "A… #> $ poly_id             <chr> "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P1", "P… #> $ method_id           <chr> "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "M01", "… #> $ eco                 <chr> "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "Ter", "… #> $ type                <chr> "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "LAT", "… #> $ param               <chr> "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "LE", "L… #> $ sp_name_publication <chr> "Ambloplites_rupestris", "Ameiurus_nebulosus", "Ch… #> $ sp_name_checked     <chr> "Ambloplites_rupestris", "Ameiurus_nebulosus", "Ch… #> $ subsp_or_pop        <chr> "sportfish", "sportfish", "baitfish", "sportfish",… #> $ calc_rate           <dbl> 0.4579, 4.8519, -0.4789, 0.9116, 3.1590, 0.9326, 0… #> $ calc_unit           <chr> "km/year", "km/year", "km/year", "km/year", "km/ye… #> $ direction           <chr> "Expansion", "Expansion", "Contraction", "Expansio… #> $ along_gradient      <chr> "Latitude", "Latitude", "Latitude", "Latitude", "L… #> $ VelAlong_mean_temp  <dbl> 1.224970, 1.224970, 1.224970, 1.224970, 1.224970, … #> $ cv_temp_var         <chr> "Mean Annual Temperature", "Mean Annual Temperatur… #> $ cv_res              <chr> "25km", "25km", "25km", "25km", "25km", "25km", "2…

what: Add polygons to range shift database — add_polygons
title: Add polygons to range shift database — add_polygons
text: individual range shifts BioShifts database associated 1-2 spatial polygons. First, shifts associated polygons study area, area sampled within original article. Second, many shifts associated species-specific polygon, polygon study area cropped polygon species range, available. add_polygons allows users merge spatial dataframes selected range shift collections produced get_shifts() function. Requires download_polygons() used prior.

title: Add polygons to range shift database — add_polygons
code: add_polygons(data, type = "SA", directory = ".")

title: Add polygons to range shift database — add_polygons
text: data range shift dataframe. Output get_shifts() function. type choice study area ("SA") species-level ("SP"; species range cropped study area) polygons

title: Add polygons to range shift database — add_polygons
text: range shift dataframe geometry column containing study-level , available, species-specific polygon shift.

title: Add polygons to range shift database — add_polygons
code: if (FALSE) get_shifts(continent = "Africa") |> add_polygons() # \dontrun{}

what: Add climate variable trends to range shift dataframe — add_trends
title: Add climate variable trends to range shift dataframe — add_trends
text: add_trends() supplements range shifts dataframe annual change climate trends (temperature /precipitation) within study areas species-specific study areas shift detection study duration.

title: Add climate variable trends to range shift dataframe — add_trends
code: add_trends(   data,   type = "SA",   stat = c("mean"),   exp = c("temp"),   res = c(LAT = "25km", ELE = "1km") )

title: Add climate variable trends to range shift dataframe — add_trends
text: data dataframe BioShifts range shifts get_shifts() function type Type area trends calculated: Article study areas ("SA"), study areas cropped species' range polygons ("SP"). stat Statistic climate trends add c("min", "1Q", "median", "mean", "3Q", "max"). exp Exposure variable c("temp","precip") res Spatial resolution climate grid cells climate trends calculated c("1km","25km","50km","110km"). Note terrestrial latitudinal study areas calculated 1, 25, 50, 110km, marine latitudinal studies calculated 25, 50, 110km, elevation studies calculated 1km.

title: Add climate variable trends to range shift dataframe — add_trends
text: range shift dataframe supplemented selected trends temperature (°C/year) precipitation (inches ???!? / year) within study areas species-specific study areas throughout duration original study.

title: Add climate variable trends to range shift dataframe — add_trends

what: Download spatial data from OSF — download_polygons
title: Download spatial data from OSF — download_polygons
text: BioShiftR relies data multiple sources. Spatial polygon datasets study areas, species ranges within study areas available [Open Science Framework]https://osf.io/tp4hv/files/osfstorage, need downloaded locally order use provided helper functions. function needs run

title: Download spatial data from OSF — download_polygons
code: download_polygons(type = "SA", directory = ".", timeout = 500, replace = F)

title: Download spatial data from OSF — download_polygons
text: type choice study area ("SA") polygons, species range polygons clipped individual study areas ("SP"). Species range polygons resolute large study areas, take longer download use disc space. directory directory within project folder polygon storage. timeout timeout option download fails. Increasing timeout may result stable downloads.

title: Download spatial data from OSF — download_polygons
text: data folder polygon storage

title: Download spatial data from OSF — download_polygons
code: if (FALSE) download_polyons(type = "SA") # \dontrun{}

what: Get BioShifts Range Shifts - Start Here. — get_shifts
title: Get BioShifts Range Shifts - Start Here. — get_shifts
text: Get species' range shift values BioShifts database, filtered taxon, study type geography. BioShifts includes range shift observations 31,000 taxa within studies conducted around world, published

title: Get BioShifts Range Shifts - Start Here. — get_shifts
code: get_shifts(   group = "All",   realm = "All",   continent = "All",   type = c("LAT", "ELE") )

title: Get BioShifts Range Shifts - Start Here. — get_shifts
text: group Rough taxonomic subgroups pull bioshifts data. Options Algae, Birds, Fish, Fungi, Mammals, Marine Invertebrates, Nonvascular Plants, Reptiles Amphibians, Terrestrial Invertebrates, Vascular Plants, (default). shortcut meant provide coarse subsetting data exploration, precise taxonomic filtering, see add_taxo(). realm Subset study realms uplaod range shift data. Options "Mar" (marine), "Ter" (terrestrial), "" (default). continent Continent studies upload BioShifts data. Options include "North America", "South America", "Africa", "Europe", "Asia", "Oceania", "High Seas", "". type Gradient extract range shifts. Options "ELE" elevational shifts, "LAT" latitudinal shifts.

title: Get BioShifts Range Shifts - Start Here. — get_shifts
text: Minimal data frame calculated author-reported species range shift values.

title: Get BioShifts Range Shifts - Start Here. — get_shifts
